provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. In this Act-                                                       Interpreta-
                                                                        tion.
     “commencement of this Act” means the 1st day of
         August, 1976.
     “existing law” means all law which, whether being a
          rule of law or a provision of an Act of Parliament
          or of any other enactment or instrument whatso-
         ever, is in force on the date of commencement of
         this Act or has been passed or made before that
         date and comes into force thereafter;
     “Minister” means the Minister for the time being
         responsible for foreign affairs;
     “Parliament” means the Parliament of Jamaica.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3.-(1) On and after the commencement of this Act, all Operation
existing law shall, unless and until provision to the contrary ~ ~ ~ . x i s t i n n
is made by Parliament or some other authority having power
in that behalf, and subject to subsection (2), have the
same operation in relation to the Republic of Trinidad and
Tobago, and persons and things belonging to or connected
with the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, as it would
have apart from this subsection if Trinidad and Tobago
had not become a republic.
         (2) The Minister may, by order, make such adapta-
tions in any enactment passed before or after the commence-
ment of this Act, or in any instrument having effect under
any such enactment, as appear to him necessary or ex-
